intro: Elaeodendron brachycremastron, commonly known as the short-stalked elaeodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a hairy texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
